section.name: Deployment guide
section.p: This Guide is work in progress.
The prepackaged WAR Proximity comes with following general configurations (for details see Proximity Default Configuration):

ul.li: The preconfigured repositories are central (proxied http://repo1.maven.org/maven2), and three hosted ones (inhouse, extNonFree and extFree).
The root of proximity storages are in user home directory.
The Proximity log files are placed in user home directory.

section.p: Now, we will see some web container specific tasks for Proximity deployment.

subsection.name: Apache Tomcat
subsection.p: Proximity has been extensively tested on Tomcat 5.x line. For deployment on Tomcat, you simply need to "drop" the WAR file in $CATALINA_HOME/webapps directory.
Advanced users may unpack the WAR and gain access to configuration files. Also, please review the logging settings (Log4j currently), since it may not be suited your needs!

subsection.name: Jetty
subsection.p: Proximity has been extensively tested on Jetty 5.11 line. For deployment on Jetty, you need some additional steps:

ul.li: Copy the log4j.jar from Proximity WAR file to the $JETTY_HOME/ext directory.

subsection.p: Finally, simply "drop" the WAR file in $JETTY_HOME/webapps directory.
Advanced users may unpack the WAR and gain access to configuration files. Also, please review the logging settings (Log4j currently), since it may not be suited your needs!
